Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) Â is anÂ application-layerÂ protocol for transmitting hypermedia documents, such as HTML. It was designed for communication between web browsers and web servers, but it can also be used for other purposes.

Scientists come from all over the world to use its accelerators, but Sir Tim noticed that they were having difficulty sharing information. â€œIn those days, there was different information on different computers, but you had to log on to different computers to get at it. Also, sometimes you had to learn a different program on each computer. Often it was just easier to go and ask people when they were having coffeeâ€¦â€,Â Tim says. Tim thought he saw a way to solve this problem â€“ one that he could see could also have much broader applications. Already, millions of computers were being connected together through the fast-developingÂ internetÂ and Berners-Lee realised they could share information by exploiting an emerging technology called hypertext

name: Build and GH-Page Deploy

on:
  push:
    branches:
      - practice

jobs:
  build:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest

    steps:
      - name: Checkout
        uses: actions/checkout@v2
        with:
          persist-credentials: false

      - name: Install
        run: npm install

      - name: Build
        run: |
          npm run build

      - name: Deploy to GH Page
        uses: JamesIves/github-pages-deploy-action@4.1.1
        with:
          branch: deploy
          folder: dist

bliki: FunctionLength

Suppose we want to build a huge house from the ground up. All the tools we need to set up the building are all pilled up within just one room.
In such a situation, organizing the tools in the right way so we can start building would be difficult.
Instead of having the separate dependencies pilled up in just one room, we should instead organize each set of related tools and group them into different rooms. Each room is independent and self-contained with its tools solving specific tasks.
We could put up labels like:Â â€œthese tools are for roofingâ€,Â â€œthese tools are for brick layingâ€, â€œthese tools are for foundation diggingâ€ and so on.
Whenever we want a tool to carry out a particular task, we know in which room exactly to find it. That way, everything is much more organized and locatable.
